intro: Loeseneriella barbata, commonly known as the barbed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Trapeliaceae. It is characterized by its crustose thallus, which is tightly adhered to the substrate, typically found on rocks or soil surfaces. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with a finely branched structure and a pale to dark green or yellowish coloration. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions. Loeseneriella barbata plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
